posts.post_content:
One of the best Wizard spells in the game in my opinion. I mean, once it resolves, it immediately replaces itself. It's insane with any Wizard deck since it just sits there and *glomps* out card advantage.  
  
This card will flat out win you the game with [Seedborn Muse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seedborn Muse) and is a staple combo in my [Experiment Kraj](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Experiment Kraj) EDH deck.  
  
Nothing less than 5/5.
posts.html:
One of the best Wizard spells in the game in my opinion. I mean, once it resolves, it immediately replaces itself. It's insane with any Wizard deck since it just sits there and glomps out card advantage.

This card will flat out win you the game with Seedborn Muse and is a staple combo in my Experiment Kraj EDH deck.

Nothing less than 5/5.

posts.post_content: Purely amazing Wizard. Use [Stonybrook Schoolmaster](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stonybrook Schoolmaster) and [Intruder Alarm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Intruder Alarm) to draw most of your deck, then play [Drowner of Secrets](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Drowner of Secrets) to mill the opponent to death on the same turn. 5/5

future sight is good, but i think this has the potential to do better  
  
changelings are also wizards

posts.post_content:
You want to make a Wizard tribal deck in EDH, probably one using a lot of untapping shenanigans. You can either:  
  
a) play Azami as your general, then win or get hated out of the table, or  
  
b) play [Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind) as your general and Azami as one of your 99, then win awesomely with a wizard-fueled machinegun.
posts.html:
You want to make a Wizard tribal deck in EDH, probably one using a lot of untapping shenanigans. You can either:

a) play Azami as your general, then win or get hated out of the table, or

b) play Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind as your general and Azami as one of your 99, then win awesomely with a wizard-fueled machinegun.
